nodes.description: Zarqawi's group announces allegiance to Osama Bin Laden and pledges to follow his orders in jihad.
Almost a year of talks take place between Zarqawi and al-Qaeda members to integrate Zarqawi's group into the World Islamic Front Against Crusaders and Jews.
Bin Laden publicly welcomes Zarqawi into the World Front, emphasizing that Zarqawi will not be under his direct command.
Bin Laden praises Zarqawi's daring operations against the Americans and the Iraqi interim government.

Zarqawi's group changes its name from Jama’at al-Tawhid wal-Jihad to Qa’idat al-Jihad Bilad al-Rafidayn (The al-Qaeda Organization for Jihad in the Land of the Two Rivers) while maintaining autonomy in Iraq.

The talks between Zarqawi and al-Qaeda focus on ensuring Zarqawi's group adheres to the regulations governing al-Qaeda's coalition partners, including anti-U.S. actions and avoiding worsening intra-Islamic disputes.
